p: The reviewed studies reported a high prevalence of climate change effects on amphibian and reptilian populations; the majority of these effects had negative consequences for amphibian and reptile populations. This much would be expected based on prior reviews on climate change effects on species generally [ 22, 33] and specifically on amphibians [ 13, 16, 34] and reptiles [ 35– 38]. In this paper, we have gone further than a basic summary of findings, having explored the geographical and taxonomic generality of conclusions that can be drawn from the studies that have been conducted within the last decade.
